Nursing Clinical Evaluation

Instructions

This form is to be used for the Clinical Evaluation Tool (CET) for students in the BCIT Critical Care Nursing Specialty Program. The CET is a formative assessment tool that is used to assess the studentâ€™s clinical performance in the critical care environment.

The CET is divided into two sections: the KAP and the comments section. The KAP section contains a list of clinical practice indicators that are used to assess the studentâ€™s performance. The comments section is used to provide additional feedback on the studentâ€™s performance.

The KAP section is divided into six levels of performance: Not Assessed, Unable to demonstrate competence, Marginal, Able to do with assistance, Able to do with supervision, and Able to do independently. The studentâ€™s performance is assessed based on the clinical practice indicators listed in the KAP section.

The comments section is used to provide additional feedback on the studentâ€™s performance. This feedback should be specific and constructive, and should focus on the studentâ€™s strengths and areas for improvement.

The CET is to be completed by the studentâ€™s preceptor or clinical instructor. The preceptor or clinical instructor should review the studentâ€™s performance in the clinical setting and provide feedback based on the clinical practice indicators listed in the KAP section. The preceptor or clinical instructor should also provide feedback in the comments section.

Conducts comprehensive assessment of the patient incorporating data from a variety of sources in a systematic and timely manner.





Applies a systematic approach to patient monitoring and data interpretation.





Identifies common and urgent variances in patient assessment data.

Recognizes emerging patterns and trends in the patient's responses and reassesses the patient's condition accordingly.
